p: The target site specificities of newly prepared SF 5-based meta-diamide insecticide 4d should differ in insect and mammalian GABA and glycine receptors. In this regard, the cell-based antagonist activities of the meta-diamide 4d against the human GABA AR and glycine receptor (GlyR) A1 were investigated. According to the results obtained from previous studies, the mammalian GABA AR α1β3γ2 and the human glycine receptor (GlyR) A1 were selected for this study [ 19, 26, 27]. As shown in Table 2, the estimated IC 50 values of SF 5-containing meta-diamide 4d and broflanilide against GABA AR and GlyR were more than 30 μM. This discovery implies that SF 5-containing meta-diamide 4d has much higher selectivity toward targeted insects.
